properties.name: Crystal Senko
properties.short_bio: Crystal Senko is an Assistant Professor at the Institute for Quantum Computing (IQC) at the University of Waterloo. Her research focuses on trapped-ion quantum simulation and quantum computing. She co-founded Open Quantum Design alongside Rajibul Islam, Roger Melko, and Greg Dick, creating the world's first open-source, full-stack trapped-ion quantum computer.

properties.name: Patrick Gill
properties.short_bio: Patrick Gill co-leads the Time & Frequency department at NPL. He is a world-leading pioneer in optical frequency standards and trapped-ion optical clocks, particularly using strontium and ytterbium ions for high-precision metrology.

properties.name: Jeroen C. J. Koelemeij
properties.short_bio: Jeroen C. J. Koelemeij leads the HD+ spectroscopy team at VU Amsterdam. His research focuses on precision spectroscopy of molecular hydrogen ions (HD+) for tests of fundamental physics and determination of fundamental constants.

properties.name: Ziv Meir
properties.short_bio: Dr. Ziv Meir is an experimental physicist and principal investigator at the Weizmann Institute of Science. His research develops quantum-logic techniques—originally created for trapped-ion quantum computing and optical clocks—to control, detect, and manipulate single trapped molecular ions, enabling “molecular qubits” and new precision spectroscopy capabilities.

properties.name: Luyan Sun
properties.short_bio: Luyan Sun leads quantum information research at Tsinghua University focusing on hybrid quantum systems and trapped-ion quantum computing.

properties.name: Christof Wunderlich
properties.short_bio: Christof Wunderlich leads the Quantum Optics Research Group at the University of Siegen. His group is known for pioneering work on microwave-driven quantum logic with trapped ytterbium ions and magnetic gradient traps for quantum information processing.

properties.name: Richard C. Thompson
properties.short_bio: Richard C. Thompson leads the Ion Trapping Group at Imperial College London. His group has been a long-established center for trapped-ion quantum information research, working with calcium ions on quantum computing and fundamental ion trap technology.

properties.name: Luming Duan
properties.short_bio: Luming Duan is a Yao Qizhi Chair Professor at Tsinghua University's Institute for Interdisciplinary Information Sciences (IIIS) and an Academician of the Chinese Academy of Sciences. His group has achieved major breakthroughs in trapped-ion quantum simulation, including stable trapping of up to 512 ions and quantum simulations with 300 ion qubits—the largest-scale multi-ion quantum simulation with single-qubit resolution to date. He is known for the DLCZ protocol for long-distance quantum communication.

properties.name: Hermann Uys
properties.short_bio: Hermann Uys leads the trapped ion research group at Stellenbosch University and the CSIR in South Africa. His work focuses on trapped ytterbium ions for quantum control, simulation of many-body physics, and quantum thermodynamics.

properties.name: Chris Ballance
properties.short_bio: Dr. Chris Ballance is a physicist and quantum-technology leader working on trapped-ion quantum computing across academia and industry. He completed his DPhil (PhD) at the University of Oxford under Prof. David M. Lucas, with a thesis on high-fidelity trapped-ion quantum logic.

properties.name: Brian McMahon
properties.short_bio: Brian McMahon leads trapped-ion research at Georgia Tech focusing on quantum computing and quantum networks.

properties.name: Rene Gerritsma
properties.short_bio: Rene Gerritsma leads research on Hybrid Atom-Ion Quantum Systems at the University of Amsterdam. His group explores the interface between ultracold neutral atoms and trapped ions for quantum simulation and quantum information applications.

properties.name: Isaac L. Chuang
properties.short_bio: Isaac L. Chuang leads the Quanta Group at MIT's Center for Ultracold Atoms. A pioneer in quantum computing, his research includes trapped-ion quantum information processing with strontium ions, quantum algorithms, and quantum error correction.

properties.name: Kilian Singer
properties.short_bio: Kilian Singer leads the Trapped Ion Quantum Information and Thermodynamics group at the University of Kassel. His research focuses on single-ion heat engines, thermodynamics in the quantum regime, and scalable ion trap technologies.

properties.name: Michael Drewsen
properties.short_bio: Michael Drewsen is a professor at Aarhus University and leads research in trapped-ion physics, with particular focus on molecular ions, Coulomb crystals, and quantum simulation. His group has made significant contributions to sympathetic cooling techniques and precision spectroscopy of molecular ions.

properties.name: Wenhui Li
properties.short_bio: Wenhui Li leads research at Peking University on trapped ions and Rydberg atoms for quantum simulation and computing.

properties.name: Winfried K. Hensinger
properties.short_bio: Winfried K. Hensinger is a professor at the University of Sussex leading research toward scalable trapped-ion quantum computing, including architectures designed around microwave control and engineering-driven modularity.

properties.name: Jürgen Eschner
properties.short_bio: Jürgen Eschner leads the **Quantum Photonics Group** at Saarland University, where the research program is dedicated to the controlled interaction between light and matter in the quantum mechanical regime. The main objective of his group’s work is to study and experimentally realize the transformation between **quantum states of individual photons and individual atoms/ions**, employing high-finesse optical resonators, single trapped particles, and entangled photon pairs.

properties.name: Wesley C. Campbell
properties.short_bio: Wesley C. Campbell leads the Campbell Lab at UCLA, focusing on trapped-ion quantum simulation and quantum computing with ytterbium ions. His research also includes precision measurement and optical atomic clocks.

properties.name: Dzmitry Matsukevich
properties.short_bio: Dzmitry Matsukevich leads research on trapped molecular ions at the Centre for Quantum Technologies (CQT) in Singapore. His group works on quantum networking and quantum communication using ytterbium and molecular ions (SiO+), focusing on ion-photon entanglement.

properties.name: Johannes Hecker Denschlag
properties.short_bio: Johannes Hecker Denschlag leads the Institute for Quantum Matter at Ulm University. His group investigates ultracold quantum gases and hybrid systems of trapped ions and neutral atoms (Ba+ and Rb), focusing on cold collisions and quantum chemistry.

properties.name: Tracy E. Northup
properties.short_bio: Tracy E. Northup is a professor at the University of Innsbruck working on quantum interfaces between light and matter, especially trapped ions coupled to optical cavities, with applications to quantum networking and quantum-enabled sensing.

properties.name: Lukáš Slodička
properties.short_bio: Lukáš Slodička leads the Trapped Ions group in the Department of Optics at Palacký University Olomouc, Czech Republic. His research focuses on quantum optics with trapped ions, particularly atom-light interactions and efficient ion-photon interfaces. He completed his PhD at the University of Innsbruck, working on trapped ion crystals for quantum bit implementation.

properties.name: Eric R. Hudson
properties.short_bio: Eric R. Hudson leads the Hudson Lab at UCLA, focusing on trapped molecular ions, ultracold chemistry, and quantum simulation. His group works with barium, ytterbium, and molecular ions to explore ion-neutral collisions and chemical reactions at ultracold temperatures.

properties.name: Kazuhiro Hayasaka
properties.short_bio: Kazuhiro Hayasaka leads the Space-Time Standards Laboratory at NICT in Kobe, Japan. His research focuses on developing high-precision optical clocks using trapped indium and calcium ions for frequency standards and metrology.

properties.name: S. A. Rangwala
properties.short_bio: S. A. Rangwala leads cold atoms and ions research at Raman Research Institute/IISER Pune, focusing on hybrid ion-atom systems and cold collisions.

properties.name: Hiroki Takahashi
properties.short_bio: Hiroki Takahashi leads the Quantum Systems Unit at OIST. His research focuses on trapped-ion quantum networks and cavity QED with calcium and barium ions.

properties.name: Jonathan P. Home
properties.short_bio: Jonathan P. Home is a professor at ETH Zürich and leads research in trapped-ion quantum information processing, with a focus on precision control, error correction, and scalable architectures (including integrated trap technologies).

properties.name: Mirko Lobino
properties.short_bio: Mirko Lobino leads quantum photonics and trapped-ion research at Griffith University in Brisbane, Australia, focusing on hybrid quantum systems.

properties.name: David J. Wineland
properties.short_bio: David J. Wineland is a Nobel Prize–winning experimental physicist known for pioneering techniques to **trap, laser-cool, and coherently control single ions**, enabling major advances in **precision atomic clocks** and **trapped-ion quantum information processing**. He spent decades at NIST (Boulder), where his group developed foundational methods for high-fidelity quantum logic with ions, and later joined the University of Oregon as a Research Professor.

properties.name: John Chiaverini
properties.short_bio: John Chiaverini leads trapped-ion research at MIT Lincoln Laboratory. His work focuses on scalable quantum computing architectures, integrated photonics for ion traps, and surface-electrode trap technology.

properties.name: Rainer Blatt
properties.short_bio: Rainer Blatt is an experimental physicist who helped establish **trapped ions** as a leading platform for **quantum information processing**, **quantum simulation**, and **precision measurement**. He is a Professor at the University of Innsbruck and a Research Director at IQOQI Innsbruck (ÖAW), and he is a co-founder of Alpine Quantum Technologies (AQT), a trapped-ion quantum computing company spun out from Innsbruck.

properties.name: Jungsang Kim
properties.short_bio: Jungsang Kim is a professor at Duke University working on trapped-ion quantum information systems, with strong emphasis on engineering and integration: microfabricated traps, photonics, detectors, compact cryo/vacuum, and system-scale architectures.

properties.name: K. Rajibul Islam
properties.short_bio: K. Rajibul Islam is an Associate Professor at the Institute for Quantum Computing (IQC) and the Department of Physics and Astronomy at the University of Waterloo. His research focuses on experimental quantum many-body physics, particularly quantum simulation of frustrated spin models with trapped ions. He leads the Laboratory for Quantum Information with Trapped Ions (QITI) and co-founded Open Quantum Design, offering the world's first open-source, full-stack trapped-ion quantum computer.

properties.name: Stefan Willitsch
properties.short_bio: Stefan Willitsch leads the Willitsch Group at the University of Basel. His research focuses on trapped molecular ions, ion-molecule reactions at ultracold temperatures, and applications of trapped ions to quantum chemistry and chemical physics.

properties.name: John J. Bollinger
properties.short_bio: John J. Bollinger is a senior experimental physicist at NIST (Boulder) known for work on Penning-trap ion crystals, precision measurement, and strongly-coupled many-body dynamics in trapped-ion systems.

properties.name: Hartmut Häffner
properties.short_bio: Hartmut Häffner is a professor at UC Berkeley working on trapped-ion quantum science and precision measurement, with interests including reducing surface noise and developing novel trapped-particle platforms.

properties.name: Taehyun Kim
properties.short_bio: Taehyun Kim leads trapped-ion research at Seoul National University focusing on quantum computing and quantum networks with ytterbium ions.

properties.name: Paul Barclay
properties.short_bio: Paul Barclay leads quantum photonics research at Simon Fraser University focusing on hybrid quantum systems and diamond-based quantum technologies.

properties.name: Michael J. Biercuk
properties.short_bio: Michael J. Biercuk is a quantum physicist and Director of the Quantum Control Laboratory at the University of Sydney. He is also the founder and CEO of Q-CTRL, a quantum technology company. His research focuses on quantum control techniques for trapped ions, quantum error suppression, and developing practical quantum technologies.

properties.name: Tilman Esslinger
properties.short_bio: Tilman Esslinger leads the Quantum Optics Group at ETH Zürich, known for ultracold atom experiments and increasingly exploring hybrid ion-atom systems.

properties.name: David M. Lucas
properties.short_bio: David M. Lucas leads the Ion Trap Quantum Computing Group at the University of Oxford alongside Andrew Steane. The Oxford group is one of the world's leading centers for trapped-ion quantum computing, working with calcium and strontium ions on quantum error correction, high-fidelity quantum gates, and optical clocks.

properties.name: Kjeld S. E. Eikema
properties.short_bio: Kjeld S. E. Eikema leads the Ultrafast Laser Physics and Precision Metrology group at VU Amsterdam. His research combines frequency combs with trapped ions for extreme precision measurements and tests of fundamental physics.

properties.name: Yuval Shagam
properties.short_bio: Prof. Yuval Shagam is an experimental physicist and Assistant Professor at the Technion – Israel Institute of Technology, where he leads the **Molecular Quantum Technology Lab**. His research centers on **precision molecular ion trapping**, **quantum control of molecular systems**, cold quantum chemistry, and **precision spectroscopy** for tests of fundamental symmetry (such as parity violation) and searches for physics beyond the Standard Model.

properties.name: Taeyoung Choi
properties.short_bio: Taeyoung Choi leads trapped-ion research at Ewha Womans University in Seoul, focusing on quantum computing and quantum control with ytterbium ions.

properties.name: Atsushi Noguchi
properties.short_bio: Atsushi Noguchi leads research at the University of Tokyo on hybrid quantum systems combining trapped beryllium ions with superconducting circuits.

properties.name: Manas Mukherjee
properties.short_bio: Manas Mukherjee leads the Cold Ion Group at the Centre for Quantum Technologies (CQT) in Singapore. His research focuses on trapped-ion quantum computing and quantum simulation with barium ions.

properties.name: Shuichi Hasegawa
properties.short_bio: Shuichi Hasegawa leads trapped-ion research at the University of Tokyo focusing on laser cooling and quantum control with calcium ions.

properties.name: Roee Ozeri
properties.short_bio: Prof. Roee Ozeri is an experimental physicist working in atomic physics and quantum information science. He earned a BSc in Physics from the Hebrew University of Jerusalem and completed his MSc and PhD in Physics at the Weizmann Institute of Science under Prof. Nir Davidson.

properties.name: Kenneth R. Brown
properties.short_bio: Kenneth R. Brown leads a major trapped-ion quantum computing group at Duke University. His research focuses on quantum error correction, fault-tolerant quantum computing, and quantum control with calcium, ytterbium, and boron ions.

properties.name: Junki Kim
properties.short_bio: Junki Kim leads trapped-ion research at Sungkyunkwan University (SKKU) focusing on quantum computing and simulation with ytterbium and barium ions.

properties.name: Dan Stick
properties.short_bio: Dan Stick leads the trapped ion trap fabrication and testing efforts at Sandia National Laboratories. His High Optical Access (HOA) surface traps are widely used in the community, and his research focuses on integrating optics and improving trap technologies for quantum computing.

properties.name: Christopher R. Monroe
properties.short_bio: Christopher R. Monroe is a physicist and a leading figure in trapped-ion quantum information science. He is the Gilhuly Family Presidential Distinguished Professor of Electrical & Computer Engineering and Physics at Duke University, and a co-founder of IonQ, a company commercializing trapped-ion quantum computers.

properties.name: Masao Kitano
properties.short_bio: Masao Kitano leads research in quantum optics and trapped-ion systems at Kyoto University. His work focuses on quantum information processing with ytterbium ions.

properties.name: Moonjoo Lee
properties.short_bio: Moonjoo Lee leads the trapped-ion quantum computing group at POSTECH (Pohang University of Science and Technology). His research focuses on quantum simulation and computing with ytterbium ions.

properties.name: Kenji Toyoda
properties.short_bio: Kenji Toyoda conducts trapped-ion research at Osaka University focusing on quantum simulation and quantum computing with calcium ions.

properties.name: Christian F. Roos
properties.short_bio: Dr. Christian F. Roos is an experimental physicist working on trapped-ion quantum science, including quantum simulation and precision spectroscopy. He is affiliated with IQOQI Innsbruck (Austrian Academy of Sciences) and the University of Innsbruck.

properties.name: Thomas Monz
properties.short_bio: Thomas Monz is an experimental quantum physicist at the University of Innsbruck and a founder of Alpine Quantum Technologies (AQT). His work spans trapped-ion quantum computing, quantum algorithms, and system-level validation, with earlier work also touching ion–photon interfaces and precision spectroscopy.

properties.name: Matthias Keller
properties.short_bio: Matthias Keller leads trapped-ion research at the University of Birmingham focusing on ion-photon interfaces and cavity QED for quantum networks.

properties.name: Erik W. Streed
properties.short_bio: Erik W. Streed is an Associate Professor at Griffith University and Director of the Queensland Quantum and Advanced Technologies Research Institute. His research applies quantum physics techniques with trapped ions to biological challenges, exploring biomolecular dynamics through ion trapping and advanced microscopy. He also investigates light transmission for quantum computing using segmented optics.

properties.name: Daniel Rodríguez Rubiales
properties.short_bio: Prof. **Daniel Rodríguez Rubiales** is a Spanish experimental physicist and *Catedrático de Universidad* at the **University of Granada**, where he leads the **Ion Traps and Lasers Laboratory** — Spain’s *only* experimental ion-trapping facility of its kind.

properties.name: Ben P. Lanyon
properties.short_bio: Ben P. Lanyon leads quantum networking research at the University of Innsbruck, demonstrating long-distance entanglement distribution with trapped calcium ions.

properties.name: Markus Hennrich
properties.short_bio: Markus Hennrich leads the Trapped Rydberg Ion Group at Stockholm University, pioneering work on Rydberg excitation of trapped ions for quantum computing.

properties.name: Christian Schmiegelow
properties.short_bio: Christian Schmiegelow leads the Laboratory of Cold Ions and Atoms at the University of Buenos Aires, Argentina. His research focuses on trapped-ion quantum optics and quantum information processing, representing a key center for ion trapping research in South America.

properties.name: Dietrich Leibfried
properties.short_bio: Dietrich Leibfried is a leading experimental physicist in trapped-ion quantum information science at NIST (Boulder). His work spans high-fidelity trapped-ion operations, quantum control, quantum networking, and precision spectroscopy.

properties.name: Paul Haljan
properties.short_bio: Paul Haljan is an Associate Professor of Physics at Simon Fraser University, where he leads the Trapped Ion Quantum Technology Lab. His research focuses on trapped-ion quantum technologies, including scalable quantum computing with cadmium and ytterbium ions, microstructure development for ion trap designs, and high-fidelity entanglement operations.

properties.name: Vladan Vuletić
properties.short_bio: Vladan Vuletić is the Lester Wolfe Professor of Physics at MIT. His research focuses on ultracold atoms, quantum optics, and quantum information processing. He is also a co-founder and the Chief Technology Officer (CTO) of QuEra Computing Inc., a company developing neutral-atom quantum computers.

properties.name: Kihwan Kim
properties.short_bio: Kihwan Kim is a leading trapped-ion quantum computing experimentalist known for high-fidelity control, multi-qubit entangling operations, and quantum simulation with ions. Recent reporting indicates a move from Tsinghua University to South Korea to lead a new IBS trapped-ion research group.

properties.name: Boris B. Blinov
properties.short_bio: Boris B. Blinov leads the Trapped Ion Quantum Computing group at the University of Washington, focusing on barium ion quantum networks and ion-photon entanglement.

properties.name: David Hume
properties.short_bio: David Hume leads the Aluminum Ion Clock project at NIST Boulder, developing the world's most precise optical atomic clock using quantum logic spectroscopy.

properties.name: Rachel Godun
properties.short_bio: Rachel Godun leads the Ytterbium Ion Optical Clock team at the National Physical Laboratory (NPL). Her research focuses on developing and improving trapped-ion optical clocks for next-generation timekeeping and fundamental physics tests.

properties.name: Michael Köhl
properties.short_bio: Michael Köhl is a professor at the University of Bonn leading research in experimental quantum physics with trapped ions. His group focuses on quantum communication nodes using trapped Ytterbium ions coupled to optical cavities, developing quantum networks and exploring quantum information processing with fiber-based systems.

properties.name: Piet O. Schmidt
properties.short_bio: Piet O. Schmidt leads trapped-ion optical clock research at PTB and Leibniz University Hannover, developing ultra-precise frequency standards using quantum logic spectroscopy.

properties.name: Utako Tanaka
properties.short_bio: Utako Tanaka conducts trapped-ion research at Osaka University focusing on microfabricated ion traps and quantum computing with calcium ions.

properties.name: Klaus Jungmann
properties.short_bio: Klaus Jungmann leads the Fundamental Interactions and Symmetries group at the University of Groningen. His prominent work involves precision measurements with trapped radium ions to test fundamental symmetries and search for physics beyond the Standard Model.

properties.name: Murray D. Barrett
properties.short_bio: Murray D. Barrett leads the Microtraps Group at the Centre for Quantum Technologies (CQT) in Singapore. His research focuses on developing microfabricated ion traps for scalable quantum computing and quantum networking with barium and lutetium ions.

properties.name: Takashi Mukaiyama
properties.short_bio: Takashi Mukaiyama leads ion trap research at Osaka University focusing on quantum logic spectroscopy and optical clock development with calcium and indium ions.

properties.name: Ferdinand Schmidt-Kaler
properties.short_bio: Ferdinand Schmidt-Kaler is a professor at Johannes Gutenberg University Mainz working on trapped-ion quantum computing, including segmented-trap technologies, architectures, and improving coherence and gate performance in scalable systems.

properties.name: Dan Cho
properties.short_bio: Dan Cho leads trapped-ion research at Seoul National University focusing on quantum information processing with ytterbium ions.
